info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 8 at 10:54AM EDT until June 13 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Hazleton and Petersburg.
Wabash River at Montezuma.
.2 To 4 inches of rainfall across portions of the basin over the last several days has led to slow increases in river levels along the main stem rivers. Localized 1 to 2 inches last night has further increased river levels with portions of the lower White and Wabash now in minor flooding. Minor flooding is expected to continue through at least Tuesday morning.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Hazleton.
* WHEN...From Monday morning to Friday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Lowest reading available from the Hazleton Staff Gage. Since the 1930s the White River has moved from the "old wellhouse" to several hundred yards from the "old wellhouse". The river returns to the "old wellhouse" around 17 to 17.5 feet.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 16.9 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 200 AM EDT /100 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY EVENING
